remarks: Change the variable ` x ` in the expression for "the unique ` x ` such that ` ps ` " to another variable ` y ` contained in expression ` B ` . Use ~ reuhypd to eliminate the last hypothesis.  (Contributed by NM, 16-Jan-2012.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2016.)
statement:
riotaxfrd.1 $e |- F/_ y C $.
riotaxfrd.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ y e. A ) -> B e. A ) $.
riotaxfrd.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( iota_ y e. A ch ) e. A ) -> C e. A ) $.
riotaxfrd.4 $e |- ( x = B -> ( ps <-> ch ) ) $.
riotaxfrd.5 $e |- ( y = ( iota_ y e. A ch ) -> B = C ) $.
riotaxfrd.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> E! y e. A x = B ) $.
riotaxfrd $p |- ( ( ph /\ E! x e. A ps ) -> ( iota_ x e. A ps ) = C ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d B x $.
$d C x $.
$d ch x $.
$d ph x y $.
$d ps y $.
